div.p: I had written that I feared some commissioners entering the Valtellina might disturb my business. But God has freed me from this fear; for they will leave tomorrow with everything safe, thanks be to God; it is a great victory. As soon as the messenger who brings the letters returns, I will immediately mount my horse and come straight to you, my dearest Bullinger. In the meantime, I would like you to diligently investigate whether the king's envoy is in Solothurn or perhaps elsewhere, and inform my messenger to proceed there, which I ask you again and again. The cause is Christ's, believe me, not the world's, for which I send, as you will hear from me in person. The Cardinal of Augsburg returns to his homeland; he senses something, I know not what. The entire papacy fears a national council. The Cardinal of Ferrara was at the point of death in Siena. That expedition seemed to be dormant. Italy has nothing new besides this. Farewell and be well.
Pray for us all. In Chiavenna, April 5, 1553. Use Ziegler as an interpreter, so you can speak with my messenger.
